definition: to bathe one's face in tears (idiom)
old variant of 以[yi3]
to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]
old variant of 以[yi3]
tears
to wash/to bathe/to develop (photo)
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
variant of 麵|面[mian4]
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc

sentences.english: I remember him crying everyday for a year.
sentences.chinese: 我记得那一年里，父亲每天都以泪洗面。

sentences.english: Seven days after the Mansion, with tears, our tears still flowed silently.
sentences.chinese: 七天的以泪洗面之后，我们的泪水依然在无声地流淌。

sentences.english: In this life, I can only get the settling in tears.
sentences.chinese: 在这场生命里，我的委曲求全也只能换来以泪洗面。

sentences.english: Fu Lan returned to Fu home, locked himself in the room, tears.
sentences.chinese: 傅兰回到了傅家，把自己锁在屋子里，以泪洗面。

sentences.english: Sometimes, though, it ends in tears.
sentences.chinese: 然而，有时也会出现以泪洗面的结局。
我的妻子每晚以泪洗面。

sentences.english: After the recovery of visual acuity, deemed hopeless, Fang often tears.
sentences.chinese: 后，被认定视力恢复无望时，芳便经常以泪洗面。

sentences.english: Many tears will be shed the day she leaves and before.
sentences.chinese: 在她离开的那一天和之前的每一天，我都以泪洗面。

definition: no thought for tea or rice (idiom); melancholic and suffering/to have no appetite
depressed/cheerless
to feel a pain like a knife being twisted in one's heart (idiom)
to feel as if having one's heart cut out (idiom)/to be torn with grief
to be so in pain as to not want to live/to be so grieved as to wish one were dead
a day drags past like a year (idiom); time hangs heavy/time crawls when one is wretched
to wail and whine/piteous weeping
lit. liver and guts cut to pieces (idiom)/fig. grief-stricken
(of a married woman) to stay home alone
to feel remorse and shame (idiom)
all day long
to weep endlessly/interminable wailing
long moan and short gasp (idiom); continually moaning and groaning in pain
sighing voice, wailing breath (idiom)/to heave deep sighs/to sigh in despair
to shed tears
hundred knots of worry in one's intestines (idiom); weighed down with anxiety
